title.narrative: FN:s förvaltningsfond för fred och säkerhet i Mali
UN Trust Fund in support of Peace and Security in Mali

description.narrative:
Insatsen är ett bidrag till FN:s förvaltningsfond för fred och säkerhet i Mali, som administreras av FN:s Multidimensionella Integrerade Stabiliseringsuppdrag i Mali (MINUSMA). Förvaltningsfonden arbetar huvudsakligen i de norra och centrala delarna av landet med det övergripande syftet att ge stöd till maliska ansträngningar för att lösa krisen i Mali. Detta görs genom en multidimensionell ansats som bland annat ska underlätta återinrättandet av statlig närvaro i de norra delarna av landet, ge stöd till maliska institutioner inom kritiska områden såsom rättsväsendet samt främja dialog och mänskliga rättigheter på olika nivåer.
Sverige kommer att bidra med totalt 36 MSEK för perioden 2017-2020 och fokus kommer att koppla an till de två resultaten under området Mänsklig Säkerhet i den svenska strategin: Stärkta freds- och försoningsmekanismer på nationell och lokal nivå och stärkt deltagande och inflytande för kvinnor i fredsprocesser och i freds- statsbyggande. Det innebär att aktiviteter som är relevanta för det svenska bidraget kan komma att relatera till jämställdhet och agendan för kvinnor, fred och säkerhet, medlingsprocesser, försoning, social sammanhållning, val, rättsstatsprinciper och övergångsrättvisa. Det svenska bidraget kommer att strikt följa OECD / DAC-kriterierna för officiellt statligt utvecklingsbistånd (Official Development Assistance, ODA), vilket innebär att all verksamhet som kvalificeras som militära utgifter undantas.

The intervention is a contribution to the UN Trust Fund in support of Peace and Security in Mali which is administered by the UN Multidimensional Integrated Stabilisation Mission in Mali (MINUSMA). The Trust Fund works mainly in the northern and central parts of the country with the overall purpose of providing support to Malian-led efforts to resolve the crisis in Mali. This is done by providing a multidimensional approach which includes facilitating return of state authortity to the northern regions, support to Malian institutions within critical areas such as the justice sector, and promotion of dialogue and human rights at different levels.
Sweden will contribute with a total of 36 MSEK for the period 2017-2020 and the focus will be aligned to the two strategy results under Human Security in the Swedish strategy: Strengthened peace and reconciliation mechanisms at national and local level and Greater influence and women’s participation in peace processes and in peace building and state building. More precisely, activities relevant for the Swedish contribution may be related to: gender equality and the women, peace and security-agenda, mediation processes, reconciliation, social cohesion, elections, rule of law and justice, and transitional justice. The Swedish contribution will strictly follow the OECD/DAC criteria for ODA eligibility, thus excluding any activity qualified as military spending.

The objectives of the intervention are aligned with the objectives under the area of support Human Security, in the development cooperation strategy for Mali, namely: - Strengthened peace and reconciliation mechanisms at national and local level - Greater influence and women’s participation in peace processes and in peacebuilding and statebuilding.

participating-org.narrative: MINUSMA/The United Multidemensionsional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali
UNDPKO/United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative:
Only about 1 % of Sweden's financial contribution of 35 million SEK remains. There are only a few projects remaining and these are in its final stages.
Examples:
In Mopti, UN Trust Fund (TF) has worked on request of the governor with the land commissions with a local Malian NGO called Association Malienne d'Eveil au Developpement Durable (AMEDD). Land conflicts is of central importance in the conflict dynamic and impacts the situation in the Mopti region.
The intervention has been carried out in two main workstrands communication and support to capacity building. AMEDD has developed public communication on the issue in order to strengthen awareness of the legislative framework. The other work strand has been on training and supporting the organisational structures for land commissions of technical equipment. 24 village land commissions have been beneficiaries of this intervention.
With regards to women's participation, TF has worked in a number of projects. It has contributed to the training of women councilors on budget management and local governance issues. It has also given support to female candidates in the 2020 national elections through assisting of registrating female candidates and awarness campaigns. In 2020 elections about a third of the candidates were women as compared to in 2013 where only 13 percent of the candidates were women. In addition, TF has supported the set-up of women dialogue activities where women of different backgrounds can come together to exchange on their experiences of the current conflict. This project also support the training of women peace makers and has been carried out in cooperation with the Institut Malien de Recherce Action pour la Paix (IMRAP).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
